column4: i'm trying to ssh to my server.  worked fine last night.  I can ping the server and see the NFS share and use webmin, but cannot ssh to it.  i keep getting ssh: connect to host server1 port 22: Connection refused.  any ideas.  yes the port is open
are you sure sshd is still up and running on the machine?
cellofellow yeah that was it. =)
sweet. easy problems are great.
i'm just trying to figure out now how the ssh daemon didn't start, it's listed in boot
can you ssh into it now?
yeah, i started it with webmin
do you know how to auto forward X from ssh?  like when i'm in a session and just type xterm it auto forwards the X to the display i'm on
it's a two-part answer
do you know both? =)
yep, i do it at work a lot :)
yeah it is
confirm that X11Forwarding is set to 'yes' in /etc/ssh/sshd_config
i asume it's got to do with DISPLAY or something
no 'dows on this network
on the machine you want the display to show up on, use "ssh -X -l <username> <address of host that runs sshd>"
yeah i knew that, just wondering if there is a config setting to auto do once already in a ssh session
like i'm already in ssh server1, let's say i want xterm all of the sudden from server1, instead of loffing out and running -X -I i just type xterm and there it pops up
so yeah i guess i can just start it with the -X -I
echo "alias s='ssh -X -l <your username> <ip address>'" >> .bashrc
now that is lazy lol
can i not make an aliases 2 words?
